column4: could someone help me? my computer shutdown because it overheated and now it only goes to the ubuntu boot screen and stops there
It's probably still overheating.  Are the fans spinning?
no i let it cool down
it usually skips the screen to select what kernal but now it isn't
does it freeze?
i select a kernal, it does that boot screen where you just see the ubuntu logo, then goes black with the backlight on
What about other kernels?
i've tried two so far...should i try others?
Recovery mode?
okay i'll try that too
well now what :/ it worked but i don't know what to do with the shell
sudo gdm
i don't think it's a normal shell...
it has "(initramfs)" as the prompt
That's not a full boot.  Did you get any errors?  shift + page up to scroll back and look for some.
yeah it has quite a few...
Like what?  What's the first one?  The last one?  The one that seems most important to you?
if failed to mount things like /sys on /root/sys, /dev on /root/dev, /proc on /root/proc
That's important errors but not the cause.  That's the effect of something.  Look earlier.  Something is going wrong so that they cannot be mounted.
JBD: failed to read block at offset some number?
That's caused my hdd errors.   You can try using a live CD to try to fix the partitions using fdisk or gparted.
D: will i lose data?
Possibly.  I'm not experienced with this very much.  You should google that error (the JBD one) and learn about it.
alright thanks, i'll try that
